Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CMCLeicester
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished, excellent location, very clean, very basic breakfast, beds fine, bathrooms fine, staff helpful. As a one star hotel can't be faulted

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paradise1982
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with my friends for a weekend. We stayed at Hotel Comercio. We choose it, because it was cheap. When we actually went into our room we were shocked. So beautiful room, and bathroom, all new and very stylish. Continental breakfast was in price, self service, and eat as much as you can. Hotel is just aroud one minute away from the busy La Rambla avenue, and I will definately recomend this hotel to everyone. There was also strongbox and free shower gels, soaps, towels, toothbrushes, razors, balms and hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: kazandlee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in May 2009 for 5 days. The hotel is basic but very clean. Breakfast is very basic in the basement. When we were there we enjoyed the fact you could get a can of beer from the vending machine near reception for 1 Euro which accompanied our KFC dinner quite well. I wouldnt stay here again but that I because I am used to staying in 4/5 star accommodation but the place is ideal if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and dont mind the basics. The hotel is central to Barcelona but we heard no noise as our window faced out onto a wall. Near the hotel is what looks like a great restaurant/bar called Restaurante Los Caracoles which had rotisserie chicken in the outside display. Very busy though so would recommend an early visit/reserve if possible, - we unfortunately couldnt get a seat for dinner but enjoyed sitting at the bar and having a drink, entertained by the barman and generally people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Exccelent for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Renata K
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Barcelona and stayed at Comercio Hotel with my two friends. We knew where we going when we booked the room cause it one star raiting. We didtn expect much cause of it. . Room was'nt big, just 3 beds, desk with chair and wardrobe and a little balcony that goes to noisy street. We would go back there again, but would ask a room on the top floor so it'd be less noice. Apart from that location just perfect and great value for your money

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo7777
Reviews.Content: I travelled June 2011 and was pleased with the stay at Hotel Comecio overall . Points up: location, location, location, friendly staff, price. POints down: hotel corridors look a bit shabby in 4th floor where I stayed, but they were in construction when I was there so I guess they are improving. I guess 40euros a night for this sort of place and location is definitely value for money. I am very happy to have paid the extra 20euros over a hostel saty, where I am sure I wouldnt have had the peace and tranquility and privacy I had at COmercio. GIve it a try, if you are not looking for luxury and are on a controlled budget than this is fine. Enjoy Barça!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location! So inexpensive & worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: WhatsUpBuddy
Reviews.Content: I came here last July with a friend & I am sooo happy we stayed here. The room was very basic with two little beds & a tiny "balcony" but who the hell cares about the room when you're in BARCELONAAAA!!!! The location is perfect, right on Las Ramblas which is where you want to be! Also a short walk from the beach. It is literally right next to Plaza Reail which is a cool square with restaurants, bars, etc. Also just a 10 minute walk from Plaza Catalyuna which is where the tour buses are! When we first got there we were way earlier than check-in & they luckily said they had a room ready for us! The elevator is small but who cares, two people with luggage fit. They have a basic breakfast, we usually weren't awake early enough for that anyway! & they give you new towels everyday! Overall, for the price and location, this hotel is awesome!! I'm in love with Barcelona & I'd definitely stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: mandymoofriend
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel, but a five star hotel is not what i paid for. Spent a week here and thought the location was fantastic. We never had any trouble at night and did not feel unsafe at all. Breakfast was small choice but enough to keep you going til dinner. Having first stayed in a room where the noise was unbearable til the early hours we asked to move and we put in a room with a window overlooking a courtyard in the middle of the building. Was a little smelly and warm but again for what we paid for, and the ammount of time spent in the room its not enough to put me off.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here. Very Very Bad.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaysabraoadlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Commercio for 3 nights. The hotel reception is basic and is situated on the corner of a damp alley. Be warned when walking along there at night, very dangerous. I recommend not to travel alone as we had men block our path whilst walking and also offering us marujiarna and other delights. Our room was on the second floor with a very small lift and stair case to access it. Key cards were given but on one occasion the door did not lock and we had been out all day, luckily all of our valuable possesions were hidden. Our 'balcony' (a rail across a window) door would not lock and was missing a handle. The room was small which included four single beds and a bathroom. The shower was more like a dribble which made hair washing impossible! There were only two plug sockets available and being four women, we took hair straightners, dryers and phone/camera chargers which was not easy to use due to lack of an electricity supply. The bed sheets were not changed at all and the beds were made up once during our stay. There were what looked like blood stains on the sheets and pubic hair, luckily there were several towels in the bathroom shoved in the bday which we used to cover the sheets. Lastly, the worst aspect about the hotel is the very poor breakfast. There was no selection each day, just the same food each morning. There were crossaints, bread rolls and cornflakes which had to be served in a tea cup as there were no bowls. The orange juice was horrible and the yoghurt looked and smelt as if it was gone off and kept out of refrigeration. We ended up not even having breakfast there for the remainding two days and went to a lovely cafe down the road, certainly a relief from the hotel food. The staff are unfriendly and are impolite. We really recommened not staying here as it is situated in a dangerous area and is a very very poor hotel. Choose one of the higher rated and better star ones in a better area. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: robertandalice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated very near La Rambla, but tremendously noisy at night.The aircon is barely adequate and the breakfast is not worth taking.The room is quite basic but clean and tidy. Staff accommodating and can speak English.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: Smiley2!
Reviews.Content: Just don't so it!!! Disgusting, filthy rooms, pubic hairs in bathroom, old, old mattresses, black feet after walking across the floor....YUK!!!! Booked dinner in the 'Sister Hotel?' Food NOT cooked properly - had to be left!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you want to spend your money on other things than a fancy hotelroom!”
Reviews.Author: Silje_NO
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights here last summer with my friend. The hotel in it self is very primitive. But it's a one star, so we got wat we expected. The room was far from cosy, but it was cleaned every day with new towels, so we had nothing to complain about. The location is perfect! About 20 min walk to the beach, 2 min to the rambla, and plenty of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood ( we did not noticed any noise when we went to bed). The breakfast is okey, but nothing more. The juice was horrible!! In fact after a couple of days we started by some fruit on the local marked for breakfast. The hotel is perfect if you want to visit Barcelona for shopping, beach and nightlife and want to spend your money on other things than a nice room (hey! it's Barcelona! The only time you should be spending in your room is when you sleep, so what do you need a nice room for?? :) Next time I am in Barcelona on a girltrip i would definetly go to Hotel Comercio again. Ond the other hand- the rooms don't exactly invites to romance, so I probably would book another hotel for me and my boyfriend. Silje21 Norway.

Reviews.Title: “if you just want a place to crash after exploring the city this is for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisab23
Reviews.Content: Me and boyfriend aged 25 stayed at the hotel in feb booked a double room was great. The hotel was very clean and the maid visited every day! The location was fab! just off las Ramblas very near to drassues metro station. The staff were very friendly and helpful. You have to leave the hotel key with them when you leave the hotel because it is more secure. we found this great and very practical, there was always someone at the desk. It wasn't te ritz of any thing special but barcelona is that, so if you want something that is cheap and clean stay here!!! Breakfast was ok filled us two up for a while so we could explore, you got a selcetion of cossaints bread, yogurt and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go there again”
Reviews.Author: paikan07
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two nights with my girlfriend for a shopping session in Barcelona. The room was really depressing but looked clean (even If I would not take a bath in that old bath tube..). I found a long hair in my bed when I opened it, but no big deal. Problems began at night: the street is really really noisy (full of dealers and drunk people singing/screaming all night long). Loud music is played all day long (since 7:30) in the lobby so if despite my feedback you go there don't take a room in the first floor. Service was ok. (They successfully gave me my key everytime I had to go back to my room..). Breakfast is not really good: bad orange juice and poor choice of food but it's still worth it to have bad breakfast for such a cheap room. Only good point: I must say the hotel is really well placed, we never had to take the metro during the whole weekend, all good stores are in a 1 km area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Comercio”
Reviews.Author: Calpechica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this 1 star hotel from 3rd to 8th Jan 2009. We had a twin room and a 3 bed room adjoining on the top floor. (for we two, daughter, son in law and 6 yr old Andrew) The towels were changed every day and the bathroom cleaned. Breakfast was adequate - cereal, juice, yoghurt, tea, coffee, croisants, bread rolls, butter, jam. The location is brilliant, the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Make up your own mind!”
Reviews.Author: exlancs65
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four nights at the Hotel Comercio in the heart of Barcelona. We chose the hotel because it offered cheap accommodation, but we should have realised it was cheap for a reason. The rooms were basic - ours had two single beds which were okay; the floor was not carpetted and the ceiling was high. There was a wardrobe which was adequate (although it had a pair of someone else's underpants on top!), and the bathroom/toilet was okay - apart from the ventilator which had months of accumulated dust attached to it. There was a small wall-mounted colour TV, but the sound had been tampered with so you could hardly hear what was being said. The view from the sliding door was onto a wall. There was a smallish desk, two chairs and a bedside cabinet between the two beds. It was basic but okay. The breakfast was included, but it wasn't worth going down for. The croissants available were not tasty at all and the coffee was awful. Rolls were available, but there was only jam and butter to put on them - no cheese or meat. The problem was the amount of noise from other hotel guests. The doors are heavy and have a heavy lock - there is simply no quiet way to lock and unlock the door. There were about 15 rooms on our corridor and the noise echoed up and down. On the first night (22nd September) our neighbours were a group of German teenagers who decided to party until about 2am. They shouted, laughed, dropped bottles onto the floor, and generally made the first night hell. In and out of each others' rooms, doors banging, more shouting and laughing. I had taken ear plugs but they were not enough. The noise became so bad that I had to walk down to the reception and ask the receptionist to do something about the noise - we simply couldn't sleep. To his credit, the receptionist said he was aware of the problem from the previous night, and within minutes he came and told them to keep quiet. And they kept quiet until about 5am when they all left, slamming the doors behind them, talking, laughing and shouting. Please be aware - ear plugs are not adequate. People visiting the hotel are well advised to take a small personal radio and headphones to drown out the noise - at least white noise would have been preferable to guests' noise. The hotel is about 1 minute's walk from the bottom of the Ramblas and 1 minute's walk from the Plaza Real. The location was superb. The hotel provides safety deposit boxes. It cost €2 per day. We paid €20 up front, and we were given €12 when we handed back the key. I would definitely recommend that guests should hire a safety deposit box. The reception area had information leaflets on stuff to do, and there was a tea/coffee vending machine available too. (No tea/coffee facilities in the bedrooms.) Would we stay there again? We would prefer not to, mainly because of the noise made by inconsiderate guests and also because we had paid for a breakfast that we certainly didn't enjoy. On the other hand, the location is superb and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad so bad”
Reviews.Author: Bologna30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel comercio for the worst seven night in the histroy of bed times. For the frist three night I couldn't get to sleep due to the noise. The breakfast was bad. If you go to Barcelona don't go to this hotel stay anywhere else. And when I go back to barcelona I will not stay in this hotel. Mary Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Powerpuffy
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but clean. One night it was noisy, so bring earplugs! Breakfast was basic but enough to get you started. Hotel was located next to Plaça Reial and La Rambla. For the price I paid and the good location I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Low recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: mtillema74
Reviews.Content: BREAKFAST: OK. It's a semi-continental self-service breakfast: coffee (instant, I believe), tea, orange juice (nope, not fresh), cerials, croissants, breadrolls, butter, jams and (fruit) yoghurt. That's an improvement compared to the situation in 2000 (when a bossy, only Spanish speaking, woman 'asked' "¡CAFÉ!"). ROOMS: TINY, but you have your own bathroom and it usually includes a shower within a (small) bath. The balconees are so-called 'French balconees', meaning that nothing more than the two front legs of a chair fit on it. The room had an air-regulator (or something like that), but it did not work. For fresh air, the balconee-doors should be left open. With the noise (the hotel is situated between the Ramblas and Plaça Reial) this is not an option at night unless you have ear-plugs... So yes, the NOISE: Isolation is what this hotel lacks of. And especially when students-on-a-school-excursion are staying in the hotel (as in our case). The doors have such heavy locks, that trying to gently lock your room is a 'mission impossible'. Rather unfortunate when arriving in the hotel after a nice night out (as did the students). We could - sometimes literally - hear people talk in the room next to ours. It's really difficult to walk in the corridors without making noise, especially when wearing high heels. Nothing I, nor the students could do anything about, but it's noisy... Since it's a one star hotel, the price is nice. This of course is also attractive for (high) schools that plan school excursions. Combined with the lack of isolated walls (really, paper thin), I don't recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford a (at least) two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: mineira
Reviews.Content: It´s a good budget hotel in the heart of the city. Beware of pickpockets... The hotel is very basic but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Could be worse”
Reviews.Author: NezzaJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Comercio is in a nice central location. There were three of us in a room which was adequate but nothing special. Towels were changed regularly (though one time they weren't clean!) and staff were polite enough. Noise can be a problem in the afternoon when people blast music from their balconies or from another room which is infuriating, particularly when you're trying to have a rest from the morning's events. Our balcony overlooked a side-street which was sometimes rife with drug-dealers and people urinating. Not the most pleasant of sights, but it was better view than what some of our mates had in their rooms. In fact, our three-bedroomed place was far superior to any others we saw. Our bathroom and bedroom were very spacious in comparrison. Breakfast isn't bad - cereale, croissants, orange juice, etc. are on offer which usually fills you up for the morning. Barcelona is an exciting city so (unless you're anti-social) you won't spend much time in your apartment anyway. Overall, nothing special but a good central location. Ideal for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: julieanns10
Reviews.Content: If you want a very basic hotel on a budget..this is the one for you. It is located just off the Ramblas in a side street which is well lit at night but can be a bit scary during the day. We came across 2 guys who were selling drugs at the front of the hotel and didn,t seem to care who saw them. The room we had was on the top floor, it was basic and clean but not to a very high standard. The rooms either side seemed to have been let to residents and it was very noisy. The outside noise was also very loud and reached a peak at around 4.00a.m. The breakfast was minimal but what do you expect on a budget. The hotel states hairdryers are available. I asked for one and was told there was one which had to be shared by all the occupants. During my 3 night stay...it was never located. The reception staff were helpful and gave some great advice in getting around this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but single rooms unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i would agree with previous reviewers that the hotel is in a good location. We had no problems with antisocial behaviour. Breakfast was good. Several of us had single rooms and they were very small and stuffy looking onto an internal enclosed stairwell. Three of our party shared a triple room which was more pleasant although noisy at night. The hotel was clean and staff were pleasant. Good value for central Barcelona but the single rooms were not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: NUIOrla
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from February 13th to 17th,2006.The staff are a little abrupt and not very friendly,but don't let this put you off...they warm up!!!Their English is very good.The hotel is in a perfect location on the Ramblas..It has a pharmacy,bakery grill room, off licence and lots of other shops next door to each other. The rooms are small but adequate, they do not have a hairdryer in the room but you can ask for one downstairs.The breakfast is from 8-10 and is wonderful, great selection...cereal, rolls, cornflakes , croissants, yogurts...The supermarket and a beautiful fruit market are just up the street on the left hand side..Go out the door to your right and head for the Quinze Nits Restaurant...(Plaza Reial)...very good value for money.We got 3 meals, 2 deserts, bottle of water,wine and coffee for 40 euros. Try the Fonda Restaurant on the other side of the street, it's just as cheap.Though remember, they do not open til 8.30pm and you have to queue... Overall we liked this hotel, it was clean and ideal for any traveller on a budget.It can be a little noisey, but just ask for a room on the top floor.It is the Ramblas after all...a little noise is to be expected But the Ritz it's not!!!!We saw no drug dealers or prostitutes????...I felt very safe here.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, couldn't be bettered. Room was fine, very clean and well furnished, cleaned every day of our stay. Staff were helpful and most spoke English. Noisy, but that is to be expected in any hotel especially in a 24hr city like Barcelona. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice and always fresh. I would recommend this hotel if you're not looking for 5 star, but want somewhere central, clean and good value. We certainly didn't see any drug dealers or prostitutes during our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Situated down a dirty side street just off La Rambla, you'll have to negotiate your way through the local drug dealers before getting to the hotel. The smell of the day's rubbish greets you as you arrive at the lobby. The various reception staff range from the uninterested to the downright rude. Most will just grunt at you before throwing your key at you and pointing towards the lift. The rooms are cramped and airless, even in the low season, and the tiled floors amplify noise to irritating levels both night and day. The accomodation might be cheap but there is better to be had for the money and the location cannot make up for the hotel's failings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, but remember you get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and the location is fabulous!! The room was very basic, but en-suite. It was very hot in the room, but it was clean.The breakfast was not worth waking up for; croissants, bread rolls, coffee and milk.....so we didn't bother, especially when you can get a nice cooked breakfast on La Rambla which is a 30 second walk away.I would reccommend this hotel if you want somewhere with a great location and are not too fussy about mod cons in your hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Comercio Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Escudellers, 15 | C/ Nueva de Zurbano 7, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
